pros: CSSMV provides a supportive professional work environment focused on the mission of serving those in need. Flexible schedules allow forgood work life balance and a strong family atmosphere.
cons: CSSMV will not compete with the for profit or larger not for profit market on compensation but their benefits are very good, and the supportive nature of the staff more than makes up for it.

pros: The work environment was great. The staff and management were warm, kind, and caring people. It was a blessing to work there and the work was satisfying.
cons: None really - the money could be better, but the benefit package was good and the pleasant work environment was a good trade off. There is not a lot of career growth without a social work degree of some kind.

pros: Flexible, you can choose when you work, not a lot of supervision, long lunch breaks, good to gain teaching experience
cons: Hard to be in different environments with different kids all the time, not a lot of help, you are kind of on your own, except they give you workshops

pros: Everything is wonderful there so let's go
cons: Nothing is bad so let's go

pros:
Big student pool
A lot of available jobs
cons: HR are difficult to deal with

pros:
Structural accessibility for all staff - open communication
Great place for entry level
cons:
Mission drift - lack of administrative resources to support programs
Huge turn over no long term incentives

pros: Everyone was really nice! Very mission driven for the organization
cons: Little outdated, but as is most work with nonprofits

pros: good team work with fun people

job_title: High School Science Teacher in Montreal, QC
cons: Benefits, old buiding, not properly taking care of

pros: The management was kind and motivated, the organization is passionate about helping those in their community.
cons: I wish there was more opportunity to do home visits with our clients.

review_title: It's one of the most rewarding jobs I've ever had - a fantastic place to work.
pros: There is constant recognition and great communication from upper management and through all departments.  Very family oriented - good benefits and time off is not discouraged.  Reminded of the difference we make in the community - lots of "warm fuzzies".
cons: Being non-profit they can't pay what you could most likely make elsewhere.  Job security can depend on government/community funding, etc.  The separate office buildings (with their different programs) can sometimes seem like completely unrelated companies.

pros: CSSMV is a wonderful organization that has so much to offer individuals and families in the Dayton area. Supervisors communicated their needs clearly while coworkers respected one another. Clients appreciated assistance and overall, it was a rewarding experience.
cons: As an intern, I had the opportunity to work with clients on a weekly basis. However, because CSSMV is so well-known in the community, there were many walk-in appointments that caused meetings with scheduled clients to be cut short. Work environment could get busy and crowded at times.

review_title: I'm not a piece of moveable equipment. I'll just leave now.
pros: They have great Benefits. Not salary. Just benefits.
cons: Social Class Prejudice. Rogue Manager who's out of control. I should write and sell my 20 year story titled "My time with the Catholics as a Southern Baptist"

pros: Your supervisors and all other colleagues are friendly and helpful, they are happy to answer all your questions since you are new to the facility.
cons: There is no salary for any type of internships, and the A.C. was a little bit too cold for some people.

pros: Very kind and helpful women, always willing to reach out and help whenever needed
cons: Nothing, just be sure to ask for more work if you are feeling bored

job_title: Customer Service in Sault Ste. Marie, ON
pros: the money is ok and the benefits are good
cons: no one listens to the frontline employees
